titleStmt.title: The second set of madrigales to 3. 4. 5. and 6. parts apt for viols and voyces. Newly composed by Thomas Bateson, Bacheler of Musicke, organist, and master of the children of the cathedrall church of the blessed Trinitie, Dublin, in the realme of Ireland.
Madrigals. Set 2
titleStmt.author: Bateson, Thomas.

titleStmt.title: The second set of madrigales to 3. 4. 5. and 6. parts apt for viols and voyces. Newly composed by Thomas Bateson, Bacheler of Musicke, organist, and master of the children of the cathedrall church of the blessed Trinitie, Dublin, in the realme of Ireland.
Madrigals. Set 2
titleStmt.author: Bateson, Thomas.

publicationStmt.publisher: printed by Thomas Snodham, for Matthew Lownes and Iohn Browne,

notesStmt.note: Six partbooks, each with separate dated title page and register. At head of title, part 1, "Cantus."; part 2, "Altus"; part 3, "Tenor"; part 4, "Bassus"; part 5, "Quintus"; part 6, "Sextus". At foot of titles: Cum priuilegio.
Signatures: [A]² B-E⁴ (-E4); [A]² B-E⁴ (-E4); [A]² B-D⁴; [A]² B-E⁴ (-E4); [A]² B-C⁴ D² (-D2); A⁴.
Reproduction of original in the Bodleian Library, Oxford, England.
